intro: Cynoglossum uncinatum var. laxiflorum, commonly known as purple heart, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and blooms. The species is also known for its medicinal properties, though it contains toxic compounds.
